name: Eden Snyder
text: For anyone considering calling this place for a tow, save your time and money and stay FAR away!! We have had not one, but TWO horrible experiences with this tow service. The first time, they left my 70 year old Father stranded in 90° weather for hours on end, we have AAA and they assigned Hank's to the tow job. They accepted the job and didn't call/notify/cancel the job to give my Dad the opportunity to get another company assigned to the job, they just left him stranded!!! Then, my husband called them last night and they accepted his request for a tow directly,no AAA,  he called them himself since they were close. They told him they would be there in no more than 45 minutes. 1 hour later, no word. He calls them back, they say they took another job and would get him as soon as they finished. 3 HOURS LATER, my husband is still stranded and calls them for the third time. They end up telling him he may be better off calling another company. God forbid what would have happened or how long my husband would have waited if leaving it up to them to follow up on a service they accepted to begin with. Y'all are clearly in the wrong business, and people can be seriously hurt or have personal things in their life that an be SEVERELY affected by your negligence and lack of consideration. Thank God they weren't on their way to work or something pressing that required a timely arrival. Lesson learned. I will be sure to let AAA know to never assign this business to my tow jobs again, and I would recommend the same to all of you, unless you want yourself and loved one's to be stuck out in the middle of the night with no help or in the blistering Alabama heat. Spread the word, Hank's is not a reliable service and should not be in the business they are!

text: I've taken my car to Brown's for about two years for various maintenance and repair work.  I've told myself several times this will be my last time because I have had to take my car back for rework several times.  The last time I visited was the case.  They were suppose to repair my windshield reservoir from a blown tire.  After getting home I noticed the hose was missing from the reservoir to the wipers and no fluids in the tank.  I called the shop and told them they didn't fix it and they said there must be a hole in it.  Clearly they didn't do any work on the reservoir or even look at it.  I took it back again and they connected the hosing and told me I needed a new pump.  I probably needed a new pump, but I felt like this should have been told to me the first time.  If you're looking for a shop that can do general maintenance work use them.  The people are generally friendly, but be willing to take your car back if the problem isn't solved the first time.

name: Sonja Renea
text:
I dropped my truck off on Friday to have the crank shaft pulley replaced. I provided the part. I picked it up Monday. I could not leave because the battery was dead. Never had that problem before. RED FLAG.

The mechanic there said something ridiculous to me about all the car batteries in their lot going dead since the hailstorm, or something to that effect. I guess I'm a stupid woman and would just accept that ludicrous statement as truth. RED FLAG. He jumped me off quickly, and left me there with my hood up. ANOTHER RED FLAG.

Then we figure it out. My boyfriend noticed my brake lights were not going off. There were pieces of one of my brake light stopper in my floorboard. The other stopper is just missing. These are the parts that keep your brake lights off until you hit the brake.

So now my brake lights were draining my battery. I had no issues with my brakes or battery when I left it with them. The truck obviously had made it to their lot after the repair, but then the battery died. Any person with half a brain can see what happened here.

I contacted the owner, who defended his techs, but offered to "fix" this problem IF IT REALLY HAPPENED. Unfortunately I do not trust this shop to touch my vehicle at this point. I have not even driven it enough to know if the crank shaft pulley was installed correctly because I am waiting on brake stoppers from Nissan.

He seemed angry that I would question his "integrity"... WELL WHY WOULDN'T I?

So $113 later, my two cents: Save yourself the hassle. I was married to a mechanic for 24 years... and some of them do this to women who they assume will not know any better, so they will bring their vehicle back to be "fixed".... It's not surprising to me that these guys have a "Ladies Day" ... I bet they get a lot of repeat business. I did notice among all their suspicious 5 star reviews the few who did have a complaint were also women. Maybe they assume we need a man to TALK to a mechanic. Or they think people like me will see that they are "Christian" business and expect them to NOT SCREW ME over. I am a single mom with a son on disability... and I cannot trust the vehicle they just "fixed."

name: Alison Gentry
text: Wish I could give no stars for the rude sales manager and all five stars to Jonathan the salesman. He should be a manager! Very friendly, understanding, and respectful. We made an offer on a truck that was only $900 less than asking price. We also wanted to know trade in value for current car. Jonathan came back and the manager said he wanted full price of sticker and lowballed $2000 less than what the trade in was worth! Did not even give a counteroffer. We thanked Jonathan and said we would keep an eye out for anything else that came up we might like. Super nice guy. As we were about to get up to leave the manager came over and started yelling at us and bashing us for the offer we made! I was shocked! He kept telling us we had no idea how much the truck was worth. The offer we made was reasonable for the truck. We told him he could not give us the numbers we wanted so we were leaving. Yet he kept yelling at us and trying to tell us we were wrong! Terrible customer service. A manager should not yell at two customers telling us we are wrong because of an offer.

name: Melanie Shelly
text:
I found the car I love 2018 Nissan Maxima. I live about an hour and a half away so I really love it!  I did all my negotiating via email and set up a test drive appointment. Very, very, easy sale for the company. My biggest disappointment is the fact that the car was filthy when I arrived and the battery terminals were severely corroded. I am convinced nobody from the service department even looked under the hood until I made them.  I wanted the terminals cleaned,  I wanted an oil change,  all fluids topped off and a cabin air filter change (Very minimal requests for a car dealership) I stated it would have to be detailed inside. The detail department worked on it but they would only be there until 12 or 12:30. So we concluded our business (paid cash) and I went to lunch without the car.  Well by the time I got back the headliner was much cleaner but it smelled terribly in the car (like stagnant mop water). Nothing else was even wiped down and unfortunately the detail department was gone. There was sticky crusted disgusting something in all the buttons so some would stick in certain positions. Literally the battery terminal was only brushed with a wire brush to knock off the corrosion. I don't think the oil was changed. When I got home the oil did not appear new. I think they put new on top of the old then they mixed together. The cabin air filter was not changed. I removed it to check because everytime I used recirculated air instead of fresh it smelled bad. It has a new one now and it no longer has an odor.

My salesman was okay, but seriously the easiest commission ever. Wish I would have at least gotten an after the sale phone call. Just to check in. Would have made me feel better about the other issues.

My complaints are only directed to the service and detail departments.

I am now looking for a truck in the $20,000 range (same as my Maxima) and I am not even looking at this company now.

text:
I was at SKCO Automotive today. I had been there for almost 5 hours. My salesman was actually a nice  man, so i have absolutely nothing bad to say about him.  After going through this ridiculous process of trying to prove my income for 2-3 hours and trying to be put in a car  the finance company wanted me to have. I was exhausted, over it and ready to leave. As if that wasn’t enough, someone decided to make a big deal out of nothing. My children went ahead of me and went to the door. They were holding the door for each other and then was holding it for me, waiting for me to catch up and come out. Before I got to the door they were approached by a lady. She told my children to either go out the door or go find their moma or daddy and they they were letting the air out. I was appalled!! I asked her what was the problem. I asked her name and she mumbled something and I asked her again and she told me she didn’t owe me an explanation!!  Come to find out she was the owner. The salesman walked up to me try to find out what was going on. She began to butt in, so then the gentleman walked me out the door to discuss it. it started to rain, he offered to grab an umbrella for me. We make our way into the building and the owner runs up to the salesman and tells him he is her employee and He better not walk me out the door. How pathetic and nasty can a human be over nothing!!
I’m sick of people  acting ignorant for no reason towards me. So needless to say I left all deals on the table and vowed to make it known that I would never spend a dime with a company that doesn’t value my business or dollar. So it’s above me now!!

And so far from what I hear the cars are junk! A friend of mine bought a van and the alternator went out 2 days after she purchased it.

Oh and if you plan on buying a car using your business name don’t waste your time. Apparently they don’t know how to process those sales!

name: Charles Boyd
text: Poor communication and double talk - two bad experiences in a row. I would steer away from this place. Maybe they were good at one time but not any more.  I want to do loyal business with an honest repair shop. This isn’t it!

resp.text:
Mr Boyd -  1) Our communication with our customer, your son, was clear.  2) Your son only paid for the diagnostic on his first visit, chose not to make repairs, and was appreciative of our thoroughness. 3) After taking his vehicle to another shop that made some attempt at repairs, he returned to us asking us to fix a couple of the critical issues of the many we diagnosed.  The fact that some key parts needed are unavailable for this particular vehicle is no fault of his or ourselves or speak to the skill and talent of our technician, nor the honesty of our business. 4) After we communicated to your son we could not source parts needed, we agreed to remove the parts we had already installed and did not charge his any labor for this authorized work.

We are disappointed to find a review not based on your own experience with us a customer.  Negative reviews with no merit harm our business and our hard-working employees and their families.  Had you been involved in each piece of communication, you would find our recommendations were in the best interests of your son, were clear, and in the end – your son did not pay for parts or any of the hours of work our technician performed.  We understand your sons vehicle needs are very frustrating. We hope he finds a solution quickly, and you get your own vehicle back soon.  If any customer ever has questions or concerns, I am always available to help at 205-663-6088. - Doug Melton

text: John was very professional at his courtesy and quick working skills at the tire and lube. He deserves some kind of accommodation o atleast a raise because he makes Watkins look like the best Ford Dealership there is.... THANKS John and thanks Ronnie Watkins

text: Excellent and quick service every time.  I get all my tires, brakes, and services done there on my Honda.  Steve, John, and the crew are always willing to help and are very friendly!  Thanks Again guys!

name: Cale Lockhart
text: Take your car and money somewhere else, like Green Garage. TAPCO kept my car for over a week while making no attempts to contact and update me on the repair details. I had to call them daily. They did not give me an estimate for the repair and I was stuck with a $200 bill after paying them $300 the week prior. I went in for a new belt and to look at an oil leak and $500 later and my oil light is still on. Also they misgendered me (transman) the entire transaction. Very cool. Also your car will be sitting outside unlocked after they have worked on it.

resp.text: Cale, I apologize that you felt mistreated. You brought the vehicle in for the oil leak and we found your axle seal to be leaking. This is on the transmission side of your vehicle. The seal was replaced and you also requested a new drive belt which we happily installed for you. I advised you that there may be further oil leaks, and we would need to keep an eye on it and to bring it back in if oil was still visibly leaking on the ground. You had the vehicle towed in for a no start issue. After 3 hours of diagnosis not charged to you, we found that there was an ECM update needed for the vehicle. This is not a service we provide, and I know the advisor informed you that we were waiting on the programmer to come and flash the ECM. The advisor should of given you a rough estimate of cost for this service and I apologize he did not. We also did not know what the cost would be for the service because it has ranged from $45.00 to $400 in the past. So as we knew the fix, the cost was out of our hands. Once the programmer arrived, he performed the flash on the ECM, the vehicle cranked, and he gave me a bill for $200. We called you, let you know the vehicle was repaired and the cost was $200. We literally did not make one dime off of you, and spent 3 hours of diagnosing to confirm we had the right fix for you ( Normally a $345 cost). If your oil light is still on, then you may have another oil leak on the engine side and would need to address that issue, just as I advised you personally. As far as misgendering, we apologize, not really sure what else to say. We will do better with that situation as a whole. We apologize again for the way you feel. We were just doing our best to get your vehicle back in your hands, at the cheapest cost possible. We are not magicians, nor fortune tellers. We do not control when a vehicle breaks, or what mechanical part may fail and start leaking. All we do is advise the best path forward with as much information as we have to give the customer the best chance to make the right decision for themselves. Thank you for business. Please let us know if we can further assist you with your cars in the future.

name: Mark Paxton
text: I had an excellent experience with TAPCO on a '96 FZJ80 restoration.  They did a complete engine rebuild, turbo charger upgrade, roof rack installation, OME springs, powder coated factory rims, installed a front bumper, welded a custom rear bumper, and tons of NAPA service parts bringing this 21 year old SUV back to life.  They are a first class automotive service and repair company with talented techs and ownership that can fix your daily driver or build your one of kind custom builds.  Great work, exceptional service, at a fair price.

name: Scott Jackson
text: I stumbled across TAPCO on youtube while finding out what was involved in swapping the body mounts out on my F250. Along with body mounts, my truck needed new wheel hub assemblies and just someone to go over the steering issues i've had for some time, that several shops have looked at and never been able to diagnose. They were able to swap everything out and found a few things I was not aware of were contributing to the slack in my steering. The combination of fixed steering issues and the S&B body mounts, my 240k mile F250 feels like its a 40k mile truck! TAPCO gave great service, communication, and very fair rates for the amount of work done. Would highly recommend them!

resp.text: Appreciate the kind words Scott! We hope your truck is riding great!!

text: Been going for there for years now and they've never let me down. Reasonable pricing and they care about the work. Always get the job done well

name: Arthur Tillman
text: I went in to get my vehicle fixed. I normally work on my car myself, but am willing to pay others to do so when problems are above my experience. I asked them to fix whatever it was that made the check engine light be on, which I knew was something with the vacuum system. I also asked them to fix two windows that weren’t working. They “fixed” my car and gave it back to me. Well on my drive home, I discovered a rat chewed halfway through my seat belt and left dropping in the floorboard that they did not clean up. The next day I let them know when I got off work and they said to bring it in and they would fix it. And they did, but they replaced my seatbelt with a black one and my interior is grey. When they replaced my window regulators, they left metal chips from drilling all in my carpet and leather interior, so they did not do a clean job and did not clean up after themselves. ALSO, my check engine light came back on and was running the same codes as it was before I brought it to them. So then I had to leave it with them for several more days. They had my car for over one week. One last thing is that my driver window was tight before they serviced it and made no road noise. Now, it leaks air over fifty and I don’t want to have to bring the car back to them for a third time. That same door now makes an awful rattling noise when it shuts, which it also did not do before they touched my car. I have had pleasant experiences with them in the past, and I left reviews those times as well but service was not what it use to be this visit.

resp.text:
Arthur,
Sorry to hear about your displeasure with our work. Lets start from the top. The vehicle was brought in after you personally attempted to repair many issues with the vehicle yourself and admitted that you may have done something wrong as everything you had done has still not fixed it and the same check engine lights remain on and the vehicle was running rough, even after you worked on it personally. We used our extensive diagnostic equipment and found multiple leaks throughout your vehicles intake system. I personally called and told you we had found these leaks and would need to take off the intake manifold you just put on yourself to see what was going on under it, as that is where the main leak was. I also notified you that there was an code in your ecu for the EGR system and that it may be triggered by the massive intake leak and we would need to correct the major leak first, and let you drive the vehicle to see if there was still an issue with the EGR system. The EGR Valve was also covered with epoxy from what looked to be a band aid repair from a previous time. This could be an issue, but during the diagnosis we did check each component of the system and did confirm the actuators and the valves were operating as they should.  Once we had your approval for the work, we moved forward. Once the intake manifold was removed, we found that you had left the old intake gaskets on the engine and also used the new gaskets of the intake manifold you just replaced. This is what we call being "double gasketed" and quickly saw this was the issue with the massive intake leak. We purchased new intake gaskets since the new ones you installed were severely damaged. We removed the old gaskets and cleaned the surface to ensure proper sealing on installation. Everything went together very smooth on the install and a quick smoke test found that the leak was no longer and the issue was repaired. The codes were cleared and the vehicle was test driven and confirmed that the vehicle was running properly and no longer had any further codes in the system. You were called and told the good news and were made aware that the EGR valve was still in question but would need significant miles put on it to be addressed. Once you took the vehicle and drove it, the light came back on and when you brought it back in we found that the same EGR code was back and found that the EGR Valve that you epoxied was blocking the air passage and triggering the light. You were not charged any further diagnosis and we repaired the EGR valve and there was no further issue.

After these issues were handled you requested that we look at your windows. The window regulators were found to be the issue at hand and they are riveted in from the factory and are very difficult to perfect. We Use OEM ford rivets and installed them to perfection with the factory holes in the door that were not modified in any way shape or form. I do apologize there is wind noise with the window now, we would be glad to take care of this issue and resolve it for you at no cost.  I was also not aware of the pieces in the floor that were claimed to be left by us, and I sincerely apologize for the possible mess left behind. I would be glad to provide a complimentary vacuum of your interior from a detail shop of your choosing. There was a good bit of mess on the floor, including crumbs and such, so we may of overlooked what mess we made, versus what mess was there before we began our work.

The seatbelt issue. We have never had a rat issue before at this location. We have been here for 8 years and never once faced an issue of the sort. We have biweekly pest control services done and stay very proactive with pest control due to the known issues of old downtown buildings and sewer systems. When brought to our concern, we replaced your belt with an OEM Ford part and purchased it by your VIN number at no cost. The interior in your vehicle was sun faded and that is why there is a color difference.

name: Kevin Sandlin
text: Don't go here. They charged my daughter $100 to tell her that her check engine light meant her gas cap was loose. If they'll take advantage of a 19 y/o girl who's out of state, what else do you think they'll do? Seriously: $100 to read a check engine light code and (literally) tighten a gas cap. #epicfail

resp.text: Kevin, I believe you may not fully understand the process of diagnosis on a vehicle. We take pride in our diagnosis and ensure the diagnosis is correct before we tell a customer any type of estimate. Our standard diagnostic rate is $100 and we roll that fee into the repair if you decided to do the repair with us. We have signage throughout the main office with this verbiage and discuss the process with customers as they drop a vehicle off. But yes, lets walk through it so you and everyone can understand. First, we read that check engine light on the vehicle, and used the $6500.00 computer scanner to do so. We went through and found every lasting detail on the issue down to the date it happened and how often it happened. That is where Autozone stops. They get their $30 scan tool out and tell you 10 guesses of items it could be. So now that we have a lot of data, and approved $100 of diagnostic work on the vehicle ( up to 1 hour of diagnosis ) we can move forward and start using our years of training and knowledge to properly diagnose your vehicle. Now my technician gets out his smoke machine (a $1600 tool)  that pressurizes your daughters Evap Emissions system and also fills the system with smoke so we can determine if there is a leak on the system. Then we put the vehicle on our $4500 lift to ensure that we inspect every inch of the system that has a fault. We also use the scanner in the above mentioned process to activate all of the solenoids of the evap system to ensure they are working properly and letting the system properly work. So now that we have used our multi thousand dollars in tools and years of knowledge that is priceless, we have determined your daughters system is actually in perfectly working condition and the only fault is that a personal mistake happened of someone leaving the gas cap loose! Whew! Seems like quite a lot for such a simple task, right?  Well what if you went by the local auto parts store, got a free scan on the vehicle and they sold you an evap canister for your daughters vehicle and then you take it somewhere for an install and spend $1000.00 and the same problem remains. I am sure this review would look a lot different if you took into consideration the time, the effort, the knowledge, and the care that was put into your 19 year olds daughter vehicle to ensure we did not sell her any parts or service she did not need and made sure she was getting the most honest and best value possible when she put her trust in our shop. I apologize you feel like we took advantage of her. I hope that you see we spent a careful amount of time ensuring we had a proper diagnosis, and realize that doing so does not come free. This business is how we feed our families and have done so for 8 years. If we did not charge customers for diagnosis, then we would become a charity, and likely go out of business, and your daughter would be stuck down the street at the dishonest shop that sold her thousands in repair work that was not needed. I am certainly glad to hear your daughters vehicle is still doing well and the check engine light has not come back on after our thorough diagnosis, with out costing her any extra money.  If you would like to further discuss this issue you are welcome to call me, Michael Lee, the owner whenever you would like to. I would be glad to walk you through our process and make sure you fully understand the extent of work we did ensuring your daughters vehicle was safe and properly diagnosed and why the $100.00 was charged. Most would consider it an #epicsave , you know, since we were the honest shop that did not take advantage of her and took every possible step to make sure her vehicle was diagnosed properly. Happy Holidays.

name: Shirrell Moore
text: I will never take my truck or car there again,I took my SUV in because the brakes kept going to the floor,when I brought it to them the assured me that they can fix it,after he called me and told me it was ready to be picked up the brakes went slap to the floor so I left it with them 2 weeks then he called and asked me why I didn't tell him I put a brake booster on it I told him I didn't know what was put on there then he charge me again to put a brake booster on there,now he already put a master cylinder the first time that was the first thing he said was wrong with it but it wasn't the problem and I paid him 324.00 the second time 370.00 when he put the brake booster on it went up long enough to get it home when I got back in town I went to drive it coming off the interstate the brakes went slap out when I took it back to him on Monday morning trying to get him to fix it or give my money back he told me my godbrother sign a no warranty,but I told him he didn't suppose to let no body sign nothing if his name wasn't on it,I asked him to contact me cause when I first took it to Tapco I sign a warranty for 12 months or 12 000 miles but since it wasn't fixed properly he didn't want to honor the warranty he originally gave me now I'm out 700.00 and my brakes are the same when I first came I really feel robbed without a weapon, but I'mspeaking with my attorney!

resp.text:
It is unfortunate that you would not tell the entire truth here and try and lie for personal gain. Your vehicle left with working brakes and came back 3 times with working brakes. (Video Evidence) Your brother inspected, test drove, and then
signed off on the vehicle being repaired and working properly, and agreeing to the no warranty (mainly because you brought us used parts to install on your vehicle). This is all after the lies that were told about the vehicle and trying to throw us under the bus after multiple shops had unsuccessfully repaired your vehicle. I hope you are leaving the other shops that worked on your vehicle bad reviews and threatening them with attorneys as well, after all, they could not even repair your vehicle.  Before we even installed parts on the vehicle you threatened attorneys for some reason. We should of turned you away then, instead we repaired vehicle properly.  I am sorry you are so upset. We do not turn out incomplete work. Our endless reviews on here and Facebook, and your brother signing off on our work after a thorough inspection are proof to my statement.

Also, NAPA Autocare provides a nationwide warranty for our customers. I would recommend calling another NAPA Autocare center in the area that will accept your business. I ask that you treat them with respect and be up front with them from the beginning and don’t threaten their every move with lawsuits.

It is unfortunate that Google will not let businesses review customers.

I will gladly accept your 1 star review. Thank you!

name: jessica jones
text: Tapco is the BEST automotive service place I've ever been to. The owners and employees treat me like family. I am so thankful God placed Tapco in my life. They have done so much for me and my vehicles. I can not say enough great things about this company or thank them enough! Tapco is the most trustworthy place and I would recommend them to any and everyone.

name: T Wilkins
text: Excellent service. Quick, very reasonable and professional. Will be back

name: Lauren Weekley
text: Super nice people, quick service, great experience!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review! We look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Moose Resumes
text: I had a bad passenger side door window, wouldn't go up and down, and they were able to fix it with same day service.  Much appreciated.

name: Jake U
text: I brought my truck in late feb. to have the air conditioner worked on in preperation for the hot summer. Some time after I noticed that it was blowing hot again. They found the leak and recharged the system almost 6 months after our first visit and didnt charge us anything. Very nice guys to deal with.

name: Rebecca Rogers
text: I had a fantastic experience with Tapco. The particular vehicle issues I was dealing were complicated and stressful but Tapco made everything easy and hassle-free.  They were consistently quick to communicate with me about issues they noticed, time frame and cost. I asked a ton of questions and they answered all of them patiently and honestly. Additionally, they did not push me to fix or change anything I was not ready to do and spent time discussing the pros and cons of fixing or not fixing a part. They went out of their way to test drive my car after fixing the starter to ensure it ran correctly and went above and beyond to contact Honda to find my radio code. The employees at Tapco made this a painless and pleasant experience. I trust them completely and can honestly say they are the only auto company I will deal with again.

name: Pete Johnson
text: Great service. Fixed it quickly and for a great price.

name: Katie Briggs
text: Tapco saved us over $1000 in the repair of my car air conditioning. The dealership did not spend the time to figure out what was wrong and quoted over $1500 to replace the AC. Tapco took a couple of hours to figure out the problem and replaced the part for $120. We will go here from now on for our car needs.

name: Charles Hubbard
text: Quick, cheap, and do good work.

name: LaMarcus Sills
text: Took my Chevy Silverado there was charged $2800 and left with more problems

resp.text:
LaMarcus,

We have not seen your vehicle since 2014 and your invoice was no where near that price ( multiple thousands LESS). I am afraid you may have us confused with another shop, as this review has been left 4 years after your last visit to our shop!

name: Jacobia Griffin
text:
(Translated by Google) At the

(Original)
Li

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: William Deacon
text: I was on a road trip 650 miles from my local dealership, when the vehicle developed a problem. Turns out the wheel speed sensors where the issue. I call my dealer who advised me to find a dealership that could make the repair... easier said than done. I was told 10-14 days before the service could be performed... until I spoke to Shannon Stull at Century Auto. I briefly defined the situation in hope that the parts and time might be available. In record time Shannon with the cooperation Chris Pope, where able to order overnight the proper parts and squeeze the car in for service. The parts did arrive and the service was performed without issue. I’m sure it was a team effort to make this happen, and thanks to the professionals who actually installed the parts! Clearly this Dealership, Century Auto has the service and professional staff to get the the job done. My night mare hunting trip was saved by the team, to include transportation to and from the rental car. Everyone I met at the dealership was outstanding, but I can’t say enough about Shannon and Chris.. true professionals. THANK YOU, for all the efforts and the time you saved me!

resp.text: William, thank you for sharing your experience and I am glad the team was able to help.

name: Necedah Townsend
text: My Porsche was at the Huntsville shop for over an week after I told and showed the parts guy and manger Shannon what was wrong with my Porsche.  We pulled up the part and I left under the impression that the part was being ordered because it was going to take at least two days to arrive. Therefore when the part was scheduled to arrive was the timing I was told my car would be looked at by the technician. Lies lies lies .... I had to keep calling Shannon the manager to find out if there was any information on the arrival of the part ... how much will it cost and never an direct answer. Every time  it was let me call you back and I am about to go follow up. And never return the call/s. After my car was there for a week I called again to only find out the part was not ordered and they were ordering it that day. Which meant at least another two days waiting for the one part that we knew I needed to arrive. The sad thing is this is the only place locally that are certified to work on my car or get parts from. I had to get a rental twice for a week because I never knew when my car would be ready. Extremely Poor Customer Service. Lastly they called me at 4:00 to tell me my car was ready when they close at 5:00 with only an estimate for cost. Never stating that they did not except certain payments. Noted on my receipt I had a premium car wash lol.  My car was so dirty on the outside. I had just gotten the inside detailed myself. Such a joke.

resp.text: We are so sorry about the miscommunication regarding our service scheduling. While we can accommodate walk in clients, our customers who book appointments are priority to have their vehicles serviced. We take pride in our service departments commitment to thorough inspections and quality work, and sometimes both of those take some time. Our team worked as quickly and as diligently as they could to try meet your expectations. We apologize your vehicle was not diagnosed and repaired as quickly as you wanted.

name: Chris Haury
text: Professional, as expected from Porsche. Even though they were backed up and hampered by an employee out sick and weren't able to provide the loaner vehicle requested, they honored my appointment and provided an excellent door to door shuttle service that was really efficient and quick. When they phoned to tell me my service was complete, the driver was already 10 min from my house. The service on my vehicle was excellent as expected, and the Porsche tech sent a video going over my vehicle and the work done. Very happy.

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see you received exceptional care from our team.

name: matthewsleila
text: I have had issues with my Macan, too many in my opinion,  however this team of mechanics and the service team are the reason why I stick with it and remain patient and positive. They truly care and always have done their very best to ensure,  although there have been issues, that they provide the best service possible and always go out of their way to please the customer. Amazing team, technical knowledge and certainly understand and practice high quality customer service. Shout out to Jacob,  Randy and Chris. I appreciate you guys.

resp.text: Thank you Leila, the guys will continue to strive to provide the service that you appreciate and deserve.

name: Bill Brown
text: Great experience for a long time coming first buyer. Total professionalism from all Century employees. No pressure and all were extremely helpful in explaining the new world of Porsche, to include those not directly involved in the sale.  Highly recommend Century and the Porsche Brand.

resp.text: Welcome to the Porsche family and Porsche of Huntsville, a Century Automotive dealership. Congratulations on your purchase and thanks again for your business.

name: raymond fernandez
text:
About over a year or so ago Porshe of Huntsville did inspection service on my Cayenne without informing me of the cost. When I called this out to the service manager he said he would make it right and explained the dealership would provide the next service at no cost to me. He said he would document it in their computer records. I counted on that all this time, so when my vehicle was brought in for service I fully expected them to honor that promise. We'll there service manager said they could not find any record. Please note that I confirmed this way back with the previous service manager that it was noted on their record.
I am completely dissatisfied with the lack of commitment to what was promised by the dealership.
I therefore  refused any additional service and just agreed to pay for an oil change (which costs $430), The car was kept for 4 hours.
I will never buy a Porshe again.

resp.text: We wanted to follow up and and thank you for speaking to our service manager Shannon about your experience and hope the resolution  you came to together was satisfactory.

name: Dave Vaupel
text: I flew to Huntsville from Jacksonville to buy a Cayenne e-hybrid and drive it back home. From my pickup from the airport to drive-off it was a great experience.  Bradley D. and Jon C. Took great care of me. I will definitely be talking to them when it’s time for the 2 seater. Thank you Porsche of Huntsville!

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see your trip was well worth it and that you love your new Cayenne!

name: Ronnie Honbuckle
text:
Exceptional Service staff from the service managers desk, shop mechanics, parts department, shuttle service personnel, the folks who cleaned and washed my Porsche and bookkeeping departments. Thanks for the courteous, timely and a job well done. Cheers
R. Hornbuckle 4/16/'21

resp.text: Thank you for your five star review! We are happy to see you received exceptional care from our team.

name: Mike Kurbanick
text: What a great experience!  Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable.  Our car was exactly what we were told it would be and then some.

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us and flying up to Huntsville. I hope you had a safe and enjoyable drive back to Florida.

name: Todd Lackey
text: Century and the team at century Porsche are always top notch. Above and beyond the call of duty is always my experience. Jacob and Chris make it easy. A+ service. Good job!

resp.text: Thank you Todd

name: Kelley Snook
text: Exceeded expectations. I purchased my car sight unseen and had it shipped to Michigan. Bradley walked me through the entire process including what to expect and timing of each step. He is a knowledgeable professional that I would make an effort to work with again—even though there are three Porsche dealerships within 25 miles of me. Everything was exactly as he said it would be and he continues to be a willing resource for me after the purchase. Outstanding communication. Thank you!

resp.text:
Kelley, Thank you for the kind review. Purchasing a vehicle sight unseen from several states away can be a difficult. We try very hard to represent our vehicles to long distance customers as if they were looking at them person, yours was easy. Thank you for your business and entrusting us with your purchase.

Drive safely.

Porsche of Huntsville

text: As always,great service.My Porsche is ready now.

name: Roy Duvall

By the way having the videos sent to me while it was being serviced was amazing.  Thank you very much for your help..

name: Becky Cobb
text:
I live halfway between Huntsville and Memphis. I took my car to Memphis for its annual service a year ago. My check engine light had popped up several times before I took it.   I was told there was nothing they could do for my car’s issue unless my check engine light was “on”.  The issue persisted and became worse.  I decided to try Huntsville to see if they could help.  To my surprise, your dealership exceeded my expectations!  I was provided with a loaner car and constant updates.  Your service manager, Randy Carter, was amazing. After my disappointing experience in Memphis, Randy and Chris Pope will be my “go to guys” for as long as I drive my Cayenne.  This car was our first Porsche purchase and being cared for the way I was in Huntsville, it will not be my last.
Thank you for everything you did. I am a satisfied customer and will continue to use  you for my future purchases.
Sincerely, Becky Cobb, Iuka Ms,

name: Charles Phillips
text: I had a major service performed on my Panamera this week.  Jacob and Randy provided excellent service. From the time I dropped the car off to getting the loaner car to pick up.   Everything went smoothly. Communication was very good.  Definitely recommend this service team.

name: J Williams
text:
I’m am glad others have had a good experience with this dealer. We have not. We found the car we wanted here in Huntsville while shopping from out of state. Initially the process was smooth, easy, friendly...until the salesman, Bradley, sold the car out from under us. This was after several attempts to call, email, and yet for 24 hrs no word back, nothing. Only to receive a call hours after all the attempts to reach...to say the car was sold. Having dealt with other dealers and more specifically, Porsche dealers...the lack of communication and poor salesmanship was absolutely horrible.

I know, in our case, we can shop at other dealers...I can only hope they treat their customers better than they did us.

resp.text:
J Williams,
I am sorry that you had a bad experience. Feel free to call me if you would like to discuss.
Jon Cunha, Sales Manager

name: Diana Bharj
text: My friend and I were on our way home from a road trip when our car started dying out, and we both became worried as we were new to the area and being both two young women we didn’t know if we would be stranded in Alabama or really what to do. Thankfully with one call to Billy’s towing services he was able to come out (even at 8 pm) after all the other towing services had closed and was able to offer his help and advice on what to do. Billy was so kind and friendly and offered to check everything with our car to make sure it was okay to drive home. Thank you so much Billy for your help and for coming at such a late hour! If you need a towing service skip the big ones and go for a more genuine business like Billy’s!

resp.text: I really appreciate that Diana, thank you. Always a pleasure. 👍🏼👍🏼

name: Amy V.H.
text: If we could give 10 stars we would! Billy was amazing! My friend and I were having car problems, and we googled different towing companies and billy’s was the first that came up. He called us and asked what was wrong with the car and then came and diagnosed the problem. Not to mention it was around 8 pm when we called. He provided excellent service and advice for our car! Thank you so much Billy for fixing our car and helping us!!

resp.text: You're very welcome! 👍🏼👍🏼

text: Billy was awesome at his job, very professional and was up front. If you have a question, he is very forthcoming with information and is not one to hide the facts. Highly recommended for roadside assistance and long haul towing needs. Thanks for the lift!

name: Barbara Yasa
text: Memorial Day weekend, Billy was my Angel, after so many others hanging up on me he was the only one to come to my rescue. I woke him up when I called and when he could not reach me back on my phone he got dressed and came to find me, he had Holiday plans himself but he stayed to help me. Had it not been for him I’m not sure how I would have gotten home, Billy went way above and beyond to help me and I am so grateful I found him. Billy my car is now fixed😁🙏🍻 Thank you

resp.text: Thank you! Glad to hear it!👍🏼👍🏼

name: Ron Foster
text: I know no one ever want a car breakdown but it happens from time to time. Travelling southbound on I65, my left rear tire went flat quickly at Mile Marker 218.  With interstate traffic racing by, car heavily packed, no spare tire, and walking to the nearest exit not an option, I googled roadside assistance.  Billy Williams Towing is listed on top for a reason.  If ever a car failure in the area and roadside assistance is required, Billy is the one you want to come and help. Very quick response, friendly, and professional.

resp.text: Thanks Ron. I'm always happy to help. Stay safe out there.

name: Kristin Mullinix
text: Billy went above and beyond to help my family and I when we were in need. We were out of town, driving back from vacation. My car was overheating, so I pulled off the Jemison exit. My coolant reservoir had cracked. I wasn’t sure what we were going to do. Traffic was horrible and with it being late afternoon on a Saturday (the day before Easter), many places were closed. Billy saw our car with the hood up and came over to help. He told me which auto part store was open and gave me directions. He replaced the reservoir for me, and then triple and quadruple checked that my car was good to go before he felt safe enough for us to get back on the road. A few hours later he even texted us just to be sure we were ok and the car wasn’t getting hot again. I 100% recommend him!  He is definitely a God send and I appreciate what he did for us more than he will ever know!  Thanks again, from the bottom of my heart!

resp.text: You are very welcome! Stay safe out there and call me anytime!

name: Shayla Currie
text: I was traveling I-65 South bound with my two daughters and my tire went flat😬...and the traffic was so unforgiving! I didnt know where i was plus my spare was bad...I just knew i had just entered Chilton County...so i grabbed my phone and Google nearest tow service and Billy's Towing was the first to come up. Omg...i explained to him the last sign i remembered seeing andhe knew exactly where I was...he got to us REALLY quickly! He was fast, courteous, patient, and very kind. I was nervous and worried because I was stuck out on the interstate with my two girls but Billy made everything better..he even got my car to a tire shop that waited for us and got me a new tire on my car in no time. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY!!!

resp.text: Thank's Shayla! Glad I could help you out!

text: Mr. Billy thank you sooooooo much for your service, me and my sister in law broke down on the side of the road and I called tow company they moved us to the next exit... so the lady did try and help but she left us where there was nothing around....but gas station no place to sleep or anything....a passerby stop and insisting us with help and contacted mr. billy and when I say he came in 30 mins he was there......he stay with us the whole 3 hours it took for the company I got my car from to pay him for towing, I was short on money I just had paid 85 for the first tow, then to find out my truck motor was locked and wasn’t drive able, I was scared but billy said not today him and his friends at NAPA auto parts and a customer helped us out with room and food...we was heading home to Kentucky, but we had to stay in Alabama over night Mr. Billy stayed with us until we found a hotel and he made sure we was safe, most tow company wouldn’t have done that....MR. name: BK Sensei
text: Went there March 16, 2021 just a few hours before the tornado that hit the area close by. These guys went above and beyond that day. That took care of my vehicle and the others in the shop even close to the time of the tornado passing. They made sure everyone there was safe and took us to the safest center room they had. I have a strong and hardy work ethic and even I wouldn't have asked these guys to work in the garage at the time they did. I have nothing but good regards for each and every person working there that day. I can't complement them enough. Definitely deserved a sixth star that day. Make sure you keep this place in mind when you need something taken care of.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so grateful for your kind words and for your support. Thank you for choosing us!

name: Kevin Jones
text:
Greystone Tire and Automotive recently performed my son's 120k Service for a 2014 Camry SE. The car performs better than it did when we purchased the car with 70k miles on the odometer. The car "now" idles quietly which is uncommon for most four cylinder engines in my opinion.
The car drives like it's new. The difference after the 100k service and tune-up is appreciable.

resp.text: Kevin, thank you for your review! We were glad to help your son out with his 120k service on his 2014 Camry SE. We look forward to seeing you family next time!

text: I was over on 280 for a massage when I noticed my van picked up a nail on the right passenger side. Thankful for these guys who took me right away to patch my tire so I could drive back over to my side of town in Trussville. If it wasn’t for them I probably would be stranded on the side of the road desperately seeking away to pick up my three small kids.  Thank you for being so kind, fast, and for having much compassion!

Great place and knowledgeable, friendly staff offering services at a reasonable price. Especially with CostCo discount. However, they did not notice the ripped vacuum-tube that connects to the driving cabin, which could be fixed from the engine compartment. Had to fix it myself after I noticed the problem. Could have done a better job on that. Otherwise great job.

resp.text: Sandra, thanks so much for reviewing us! We appreciate your kind words and are glad to hear that we are your go-to guys for car repairs! Have a wonderful day, and we look forward to working with you again in the future.

text: Probably one of the worst customer service experiences I’ve ever had in my life. In short, I had to have it towed there TWICE because they never fixed the problem in the first place, my CAR WAS STOLEN because they left the keys in the car overnight, and then they jerked me around for months after and even refused to pay for getting a new key (that was stolen out of the car.) The owner seems nice, but the people at the front of the house constantly lied to me and my family. Awful, awful service.

Super awesome helpful staff and will definitely use them again in the future.

name: Deanna Helton
text: So I post many reviews and honestly I hate for them to be negative but I have had a horrible experience here. I went in on Tuesday 12/18 because my car was running hot. Tammy was nice enough to give me a ride home while I waited. Firstly my car was not correctly diagnosed I spent over 500$ here and still having the same issue. When I picked it up drove toward Wal-Mart it immediately got hot so the looked at it again right before closing then i leave again same thing finally I park in publix to let it cool down. Again in the morning I take it back. Again they check it send me on my way 30 minutes later car hot again. I call and was pretty much brushed off and was told that they fixed what they thought was the problem. So as of right now I've been charged all this money car still running hot n they acting like it's cool I came in with 1 problem which has still not to be resolved. I will I'm so disappointed I travel alot for work and I'm in Alabama all alone no family I came here expecting a1 service seeing that it's connected to a napa but to spend this type of money and my issue not be fixed I'm so disappointed. Now I have to go get my car worked on all over again so I can hopefully make it home for Christmas.

name: Randy Jaudon
text: Great Place, Quick, Clean  & Friendly.  Tammy was great.  I have a new place to service my vehicle.

name: trish velez
text: BEWARE....Don’t trust these guys. We needed a headlight changed on our Prius. We were told how much. When we returned to get the car they charged us an extra $15.00 because they said in was hard! My husband asked well why didn’t you call us first to make sure it was okay. They didn’t have an answer.

text: This is the only place I take our vehicles to.

text: Very friendly and knowledgable staff.I will not take my car anywhere else!!

name: Wj Brown
text:
My daughter’s 07 Kia Sorento stopped on her on the freeway in Atlanta, she had it towed to a shop in Atlanta. They replaced the battery and alternator 500.00.  Two weeks later she is getting warning lights on the dashboard. Fearing that it might be more problems, when she came home for a wedding, I called Greystone Auto and took it in for a diagnostic. In less then 30 mins, results were in; defective alternator(new) . The folks at Greystone called the Atlanta shop and coordinated an under warranty replacement. That was a blessing not to have to worry about my daughter having a malfunctioning car while living there alone.
I have always gotten good service and fair prices here. I have had at least 5 repairs done there and never a complaint.
Thanks Brooke and all the folks there for easing our anxieties.! Now I have another review to write about that Atlanta shop 😡!

name: Marnie Cowan
text: We recently took a car here to get a pre-purchase inspection done, and had a great experience as they were professional, efficient and knowledge and offered a reasonable price.

name: Karen Estes
text:
Women: do not go there! Send a man!  I had trouble getting someone at the desk. I need a new light for my brakes (just one). They wanted $40.00 and I have the bulb !  No respect !!
As a woman I am used to being taken advantage of!!!!!!’

resp.text: Hello, Karen. Unfortunately we were slammed this morning so we apologize if we were not able to get to you sooner at the counter. We were not able to install this for you because you bought the part through Autozone and for legal reasons we must install our own parts in the shop. We would never discriminate or take advantage of anyone based on their gender, the reason we could not help you is simply because the part was not purchased through us. If you'd like to discuss this further, feel free to call us at the shop. Thank you.

name: Ben Pickett
text: Incredible service with great prices, these guys will really bend over backwards to make sure you're happy.

name: Miguel Davis
text: Great and quick service.

name: Mitchell G Lattof Jr
text: I had gone to Pep Boys to get my headlight repaired. After keeping my car for 3 days trying to "diagnose" an electrical problem, Pep Boys informed me that I needed my entire headlight assembly replaced and it would take a week to get the part in and cost $2,700.00. I declined and took my car to Downtown Car Care for a 2nd opinion. After an hour or so, DCC determined that all I needed was a FUSE replaced and a new bulb. DCC saved me $2,500+ and they'll be my first "go-to" place for future repairs. They are extremely professional and friendly and I was very impressed with how clean their shop is. I highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Mitchell. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us

name: Alison Herlihy
text: Harold and everyone at Downtown Car Care did a great job getting my classic car up and running again! There aren't many mechanics around who can work on a 60+ year old car, let alone who will be totally honest with you about what they can do and do the work for a fair price. I'd recommend Downtown Car Care to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for the great recommendation Alison! Always nice to hear from satisfied customers!

name: John Pickering
text:
Super fast, friendly team. The owner greeted me warmly, and his friendly team kept great communication. The price was downright astoundingly good for such a well-kept, professional garage in the downtown area.

I live in the downtown area and Downtown Car Care will be my garage for my maintenance needs from now on.

resp.text: John, thank you so much for the review and excellent feedback! Please come see us again anytime in the future!

name: Brittany Costello
text: Hands down the best experience I’ve ever had with a car repair shop! I got a flat tire just hours before my flight was scheduled to leave and they we’re able to fit me in and finish the job extremely fast, the day before a major holiday! The staff was a delight to work with... Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing us, it was our pleasure Brittany!

name: J. Craig Dickson
text: Fast and friendly service. Extremely reasonable rates compared to dealerships and you still have ASE Certified Mechanics that can do the work you can trust! I have known Harold 2 decades and he is as good as they get in bringing resolution to a car issue or concern. I would trust my mom, my wife, my sister and any daughter to go there alone and know they would be well taken care of there! Great job Harold and Chris!!

resp.text: We're delighted to hear how much trust and confidence you have in us! Thanks for the amazing review!

name: Fatima DZ
text: Just moved in town and finally i found a honest guys that can fix my car without breaking other parts. Chris is the guy that you should talk. I will give 7 * to him.

resp.text: Thank you so much Fatima! I appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.

name: Michael Scott
text:
My girlfriend and I recently came into some critical car troubles while we were moving to New Orleans. We stopped in the nearest town which was Mobile. We took our van to Downtown Car Care and they helped us out big time. We were looking at a 1000+ service request to change and fix our transfer case. We didn't have that kind of time or money to stay there and wait for that to happen. It is a 94' so they would have had to track down the part first. Time is money. The dudes at the shop found a temporary way to get our van running safely without even changing it. Ran and still runs like a beaut. Only charged us $20 for the whole thing. Easily could have taken our asses for a ride. Solid people working at this place and would recommend them to anyone if i lived in Mobile.

Thanks for all your help.

resp.text: I’m so glad to hear you had such a positive experience! Thank you!

name: Only Hazardous (Ryan Nichols)
text: My name is Ryan, and I’ve dealt with Harold personally on MANY accounts and I have never once been dissatisfied. Super friendly guy, honest, and he’ll get the job done quick. 10 out of 10 will do business again!

resp.text: So happy to hear you have always been satisfied with our services. We really appreciate the review you have left us!

name: Unicorn Sparkle with Anne Michael
text: I had a flat tire the other day while I was downtown. The people at Downtown Car Care really took exceptional care of me! They were so friendly and welcoming when I pulled in. They knew I needed my car fixed quickly since it was almost time for carpool that afternoon.  They were quick with patching my tire, and got me back on the road in no time! I will definitely be going back to see Harold at Downtown Car Care!

resp.text: We love hearing from satisfied customers! It makes all the hard work worth it. Thank you!

name: Luke Hildreth
text: They were more then fair with price . I was in a bind and they  were amazing.

resp.text: We're glad we could help, thank you Luke. Take care!

name: john
text: I brought my wife's car in for a few things (power steering pump, alignment, and oil leak) right before we left for vacation. As we were on vacation the shop kept us updated on everything that was going on. (A part was having to be ordered from out of state) The original quote was $1,000 which I was OK with because they wanted to do a transmission flush as well. For the amount of work and parts I was happy with price. They called about half way through our week long trip to give us an update and the shop owner stated he would have it done before we got back or worst case senario, the day we got back. He also stated he thought it would be a bit cheaper, about $950, well that's great. No problem there! So the day we got home he called and said the car was finished and that he was able to do all the work for $860!!! He very well could have charged me the $1000 and I would have gladly payed. He instead did the honorable thing and charged me what it cost him! Also, very clean shop!!

resp.text: Thank you, John! We’re thrilled that you’re happy with our services.

name: Deona Elaine
text: I was on my way to New Orleans and blew a tire on the interstate on the way. Downtown car care was the closest place to me and I’m so glad I was able to get their help. As soon as I called, they sent a tow truck and the owner was able to work with me on the cost of the tire I needed. Because I had a security bolt on my wheel and didn’t have the key for it, they had to remove the bolt — and they handled it for free! Instead of replacing both tires in the back, they only replaced the one that blew after looking at the condition of the other wheel which was super helpful since I told them I was on a budget. Since I’m a female, I’ve always felt wary of mechanics, but since visiting this shop, they’ve restored my faith in the business! Thank you for your hard work, flexibility, and kindness!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review, Deona! We take great strides to make sure our clients are satisfied and appreciate when a client sees that we work hard on their behalf.

name: John Connolly
text: Fast service. Friendly staff. Really helped us out in a bind and got us back on the road again quickly. Breaking down in an unfamiliar area, states away from home, can be daunting. Everyone was exceptional.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave such a thoughtful review, John. It’s customers like you that make our job so enjoyable!

name: Cody Plaisance
text: My wife and I were traveling to Gulf Shores from Baton Rouge for a family vacation and at 3:00 both our rear breaks went out and we managed to get it to Downtown Car Care and they took it in, fixed it, and were back on the road in no time at all. This was all at an extremely reasonable price and would recommend these people to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for the review! We hope your vacation goes super awesome!

name: NamJung Homeschool
text:
I am YounJi from University of Alabama. My family and I had a trip to Mobile, and our car stopped working on a roadside. We looked up all the reviews and chose "Downtown Car Care" to help us.

The car broke down at 3pm on Friday. We thought there is no way to fix this car since it was late of the day. However, this place shocked me with the fastest service. They changed the broken alternator and replace to a new one in an hour. We really didn't wait at all. Plus, their customer service was great (the nicest mechanics ever seen!).

I truly recommend this place. This place saved our summer trip.
Again, choose this place for your car repair.

I also want to leave a thank-you note to the crew. Thank you for your amazing service!

resp.text: All in a day’s work, glad you’re happy with the results!

name: Tony Anthony
text: My name is Tony & I am the Service Manager at Colony One Auto Center in Stafford Tx. Our shop pride's itself in excellent customer service, after dealing with Harold Burns/ Chris over a potential catastrophe with one of our customers traveling through Mobile..........I can't be more grateful there are shops like this! These guy's were courteous, immediate and effective, its hard to get all those on the drop of a dime in an emergency situation. If anyone is travelling through Mobile (or near) or live in the area of, don't take my word for it, give these guy's a try! My thanks and gratitude for all you did Mr. Burns, Chris and the business as a whole!!!!!

Additionally they charged me $120 for a diagnostic scan and clearing trouble codes. I own a scan tool and I scanned it prior to dropping it off. There were no trouble codes...none.

Typically insurance would pay for this. I won’t be. This is why insurance is more expensive than it should be.

name: Virginia Akin
text:
Our experience was GREAT....Until....

CarMax has a reasonable policy of collecting sales tax based on the county where the car is purchased rather than one's home county.  We were charged a higher rate due having to shop out of our home county (no CarMax in our immediate area) and the county where we shopped has a significantly higher rate than our home county.  We were informed they had to collect the higher amount but we could take a paper they provided, have our local tag office fill out the amount for our local office, bring it back in, and they would refund the overage.  That is understandable and reasonable and we appreciated the paperwork being provided.

After going to the local tag office I made the drive back over to drop off the paperwork and I thought would receive the overage that day.  I was informed it would have to be processed by the central office but would be handled within approximately 10 business days.  Thirty days after dropping the paperwork off to them I had heard nothing so I called the local office and was informed it should have already been processed, they were sorry, and they would have someone call me within a day or two.  Two business days later I called again and was informed the process could take around 3 MONTHS.

I am currently waiting to hear from the Central Office in Virginia to find out how long they intend to keep the overage.  The site we used did quite well for us in finding the car we were looking for and handling all the paperwork for a cash sale.  The local tag office was impressed with how organized the paperwork was.  We were quite happy with everything.  Until we hit this glitch.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share feedback about your experience, Virginia. Our goal is to ensure all of our customers receive exceptional service, so it's disappointing to hear that your experience has been anything less than exceptional. We’d like the chance to learn more and to see how we may be able to help. Would you mind reaching out to us at socialcare@carmax.com or please give us a call at 1-800-519-1511 regarding any unaddressed questions or concerns you have? From there, we can help coordinate additional communication for you right away. Thank you. – Your Customer Care Team

text: I has a wonderful experience with Carmax in Mobile, AL. I normal dread having to anything that involves a car lot but This was by far the best experience! The customer service was unmatched, the timing and quickness of the transaction was amazing. they were also very transparent about everything! Highly recommend them to anyone!

name: Billy Robinson
text: We were not on the schedule, but we were seen in a reasonable amount of time. Mattie started our experience with professionalism, kindness, and courtesy. She helped us through the assessment process with explanation of what was being done and what was next. We waited for the quote. Once we decided to accept the quote offered, we had to leave to prepare for the sale. We returned later in the afternoon. Robert completed the sale of our vehicle to Carmax. We were satisfied with this sale experience. Thanks for buying our Ford Explorer.

name: Patricia West
text:
All of the salespeople were great. I got friendly service and a reasonable car at a reasonable price. The trouble started when I got home, and the car started having issues same day. I brought it to the service department at Carmax and they said they would fix it in a month. After arguing, I was able to get a loaner for free because the car was broken when I bought it. They have had the vehicle over a month and will not return my calls. I would not recommend purchasing from here, unless you want a broken car with no updates. The sales employees were very nice however. Management at the Mobile store claimed they were understaffed after I called the customer relations representatives and told them the situation.

Understaffed shouldn’t prevent a 30 second call back for an update about the vehicle when the customer service line was called 8 days in a row.

I’m typically not the type to complain on these types of forums, but the service was absolutely ridiculous and I wouldn’t recommend a single person buy a vehicle here.

resp.text: Hi there, Patricia. We are grateful that you've shared feedback with us here to make us aware of your concerns with your vehicle. We would appreciate the opportunity to look into your service experience further. If you would like to reach out to us at socialcare@carmax.com or give us a call at 1-800-519-1511 with your contact information, we will be happy to meet you there to get started. Thank you. – Your Customer Care Team

text: I don't think I will buy a car anywhere else. The experience was great from beginning to end. The staff was welcoming and guided us along the way.  NO HASSLE.   Be sure that you have all info. to register your car and get your tag before you leave.  Papers were shipped and the package was missing one form.  They quickly resolved the issue and all was fine.

name: Jessica Pearson
text:
I'm gonna give them three stars, and here's why. It was a rough transaction. I had a new( but very sweet) sales boy. However, there was an issue with the price being different than when I had it transferred in. There was a bit of pressure on me to purchase the car the day I walked in if I wanted the lower price. I was disappointed with the sales tactics so I walked out.
However, the manager did call me and made it right. I came back and worked with the very same sweet salesman and I ended up with a great car for a great price. All in all I would probably use them again because it was still better than traditional car lots.
A couple of lessons learned: if you have your own financing do not go on the weekend. They will insist on you using their financing which means you'll get another hit on your credit. If you transfer a car in, and it comes in on the weekend, wait till Monday if your not getting your loan through them. Also, they may try to raise the price on you so be prepared.

CarMax took all that worry away I was in and out within 2 hours and back on the road home in my brand new Car. The service was amazing from the time I walked through the doors. Everyone greeted me and was really friendly.I would recommend CarMax to anyone I know looking to purchase a used car. My salesman was a tall guy with blonde hair, really amazing and so helpful! You have to keep calling 3 or 4 times before something is done. I would not recommend ever buying from this location as they are literally the slowest car dealership I have ever dealt with.

text:
I had the car I bought shipped from Texas.  When I went to test drive and drive it, I noticed a small square indention on the passenger side back bumper. It was agreed that they would replace the bumper if I bought the car.  They did have the bumper replaced at a reputable body shop and also had to replace the blind spot monitor which was the square I saw on the bumper.  Even though it took a couple weeks, the bumper came out great.  Be sure to carefully look over any car that was shipped as the shipping company tends to bump cars around a bit.

I really like the car and the cost of fixing the bumper and blind spot monitor was over $3000 which CarMax paid in full.

name: Taylor Presley
text: If I could give zero stars I absolutely would. I bought the car in January from the Pensacola location and it came with one key I was told they would give me a second key for no charge because I live in mobile they made arrangements for me to get the key made there. I took the car to my appointment in mobile and dropped it off and picked it up the next day I was told the person who made the keys didn’t have the one they needed for me and that they would call me once he finished. Over a month later I had received no call back so I stopped by and they had no idea what I was talking about they got my information and said they would call me again they never did. I called the Pensacola store to see if there was an issue and talked to a manager he said he would email me a new repair order I never received it. I stopped by mobile yet again with the copy of my original repair order and they said they would make me a new appointment to get the key made which they knew beforehand I would not be able to attend I was told they would talk to their service manager and try to make arrangements because I had already left the car once and could not miss work to bring my car in again. Once again I never got a call back the day before my appointment I made a phone call to see if they had figured anything out and was told the girl I had talked to wasn’t working today and that they would look into it and call me back. Not once did I receive any kind of phone call or email the entire 4 months I have been trying to get this situation taken care of.

resp.text: Good afternoon, Taylor. Thank you for reaching out to us here. We understand the importance of clear communication and apologize for the inconvenience. We would be grateful for the chance to help in getting this resolved and encourage you to call (800) 519-1511 or email socialcare@carmax.com for further assistance. Thank you.- Your Customer Care Team

name: HJ Sullivan
text: My experience with CarMax in Mobile, AL was very positive. I was looking for a specific car (Genesis G70, manual transmission) and I traveled from Huntsville, AL to look at it. I called before making the trip and the car was reserved. In addition, the saleswoman, Tchana reached out to me on the way down to make sure that I had everything I needed for the transaction. Since it was New Year's Day, I had to wait a day for my lender to be open, but I was still able to test drive the vehicle. It only had about 2400 miles on it and the price was fair; much better than what other dealerships were charging. The process took a while, but it went very smooth. I received a good price for my trade-in and CarMax gave me a full tank of gas for my trip back to Huntsville. This car has turned heads and it was a pleasure to work with Tchana at CarMax.

name: Michael Foster
text: Carmax let me down on this one, big time.  I arrived 15min early for an appointment and was told to wait by a gentleman, No biggie I had driven 4 hours from out of state, but I'm a pretty patient guy. I waited 40 minutes, (25 min AFTER my appointment, only to be helped by the gentleman that greeted me, who hadn't been helping anyone for the whole 40 minutes I sat there.  Both minor issues, but in the light of the experience add to the frustration. They list the vehicle as a Toyota Tacoma SR5. At the time I wasn't aware of how to tell the subtle differences between an SR and an SR5...now I do and I feel a bit cheated. I don't understand how that mistake can happen. I noticed it when I put my Vin to register with Toyota. I have the window sticker right here.....Secondly, they did a real bate and switch on me with the financing. I needed the truck for work and decided to try and work with he other finance company directly after the purchase. And Finally they didn't issue me a temporary tag, but some 3 day pass. This shouldn't have been a problem, but they didn't get me my paperwork to register the vehicle for 11 days. I got pulled over and was issued a ticket. The ticket will be thrown out but it is still a hassle to bring my registration to court to prove I did it and take the time out of my day to do it. Very unprofessional from start to finish. This was my second Carmax purchase, but will probably be my last.

name: Sofia B.
text:
I bought my car here a few weeks ago and this is how it went.
I used carmax.com and the carmax app to pick out a car, after someone at the store recommended the make and model to me (Mattie) based on what I was looking for. Unfortunately, she is wasn’t the same person to help us with purchasing the vehicle. For that we were assigned someone else.
She seemed to work a little slower than the other salespeople, but it wasn’t too bad. It was only a little frustrating because I didn’t expect it to take two hours. Before we showed up for the test drive appointment, I already had as much as I could completed online, the loan was already prepped through another bank, and I even had the insurance quote ready.
Then the very next day we were having some issues with the radio. I called, scheduled an appointment, and proceeded to wait another 1.5 hours after my appointment time for my car to be taken out of the parking lot to get looked at. After about 15 minutes, they agreed that there was an issue and said that they would have to call me back to schedule the installation after they order and receive a new radio. It’s been 10 days. No one called. I found a work around for the issue and am not interested in calling them again. I’m honestly worried that they could mess it up more and don’t want to risk it. I can’t say that I trust their service.

Then the bank called almost two weeks after purchasing the car. They told us that had been trying to get a hold of carmax, but that they’ve been ignoring them. They called and faxed them on two occasions. I’m sure they emailed as well, but I don’t know that for sure. They called us because they were in need of the paperwork to process the loan and asked us to try and contact carmax ourselves. I was a little frustrated then because I assumed that the initial purchasing process took that long because the girl wanted to make sure it was done properly. Now I’m left wondering what exactly she was doing the whole time. My husband called carmax, and I can’t exactly state what was said,  but they assured us that they would take care of it. Then the bank called again a FEW DAYS after we called carmax to let us know that they finally got a hold of them and are hopeful to receive the paperwork within the next 24-48 hours..

In theory, the carmax car buying process should be super smooth and simple. We are (mostly) satisfied with the car, but I can’t say that the service met our expectations.
